title: Microsoft will give disgruntled G Suite legacy users a sweet deal on Microsoft 365
content:
Google announced in January that it was shutting down its free G Suite legacy edition plans, forcing everyone to either switch to a personal Gmail account (leaving all their digital non-transferable purchases behind) or open their wallet for a paid G Suite subscription. The ensuing outrage caused Google to start working on a data migration

The post Microsoft will give disgruntled G Suite legacy users a sweet deal on Microsoft 365 appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Microsoft is swooping in on small businesses annoyed at Google over G Suite changes, with a 60% discount on the first year of Microsoft 365.
